content.question:
A two-sample <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test for a difference in means was conducted to investigate whether defensive players on a football team can bench-press more weight, on average, than offensive players. The conditions for inference were met, and the test produced a test statistic of <math alttext="t equals 1.083" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1.083</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and a <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value of 0.15.
Based on the <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value and a significance level of <math alttext="alpha equals 0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Î±</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, which of the following is the correct conclusion?

choices.label: Reject the null hypothesis because <math alttext="0.15 is greater than 0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.15</mn><mo>></mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. There is not convincing evidence that defensive players can bench-press more weight, on average, than offensive players.

Reject the null hypothesis because <math alttext="0.15 is greater than 0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.15</mn><mo>></mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. There is convincing evidence that defensive players can bench-press more weight, on average, than offensive players.

Fail to reject the null hypothesis because <math alttext="0.15 is greater than 0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.15</mn><mo>></mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. There is not convincing evidence that defensive players can bench-press more weight, on average, than offensive players.

Fail to reject the null hypothesis because <math alttext="0.15 is greater than 0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.15</mn><mo>></mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. There is convincing evidence that defensive players can bench-press more weight, on average, than offensive players.

Fail to reject the null hypothesis because <math alttext="0.15 is greater than 0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.15</mn><mo>></mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. There is convincing evidence that defensive players can bench-press the same amount of weight, on average, as offensive players.

content.answer: Fail to reject the null hypothesis because <math alttext="0.15 is greater than 0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.15</mn><mo>></mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. There is not convincing evidence that defensive players can bench-press more weight, on average, than offensive players.

topic.text: 7.9: Carrying Out a Test for the Difference of Two Population Means

skill.text: Skill 4.E: Justify a claim using a decision based on significance tests.
